items.question: What are the office hours of the {{hallName}}?
items.answer: The {{hallName}} is open Monday to Friday, 8:00 AM to 5:00 PM, with a lunch break from 12:00 PM to 1:00 PM. We are closed on weekends and national/local holidays.

items.question: How can I contact a specific city office?
items.answer: Visit our Government Directory page to find contact information for all city offices and department heads.

items.question: Can I request services online?
items.answer: Currently, most services require in-person applications. However, we are working on implementing online services for select transactions. Check individual service pages for updates.

items.question: How long does it take to get a birth certificate?
items.answer: For birth certificates registered in {{lguName}}, it typically takes 15-30 minutes while you wait, provided the record is readily available.

items.question: Can someone else request my certificate for me?
items.answer: Yes, but they must bring: an authorization letter signed by you, valid ID of both you and the representative, and a photocopy of your valid ID.

items.question: What is the difference between PSA and local civil registrar certificates?
items.answer: Both are certified true copies. PSA certificates are the nationally-recognized version required for passport and visa applications. Local civil registrar certificates are accepted for most local transactions and are often processed faster.

items.question: When should I renew my business permit?
items.answer: Business permits must be renewed annually, preferably in January. The deadline for penalty-free renewal is typically January 20th of each year.

items.question: What do I need to start a new business in {{lguName}}?
items.answer: To start a new business, you'll need: DTI Registration (for sole proprietorship) or SEC Registration (for corporation), Barangay Clearance, Community Tax Certificate (Cedula), Location Sketch/Map, and Contract of Lease (if renting). Visit our Business Permit page for complete details.

items.question: What payment methods are accepted?
items.answer: Currently, we accept cash payments at the City Treasurer's Office. We are working on implementing online payment options for taxes and fees.

items.question: How can I pay my real property tax?
items.answer: Visit the City Treasurer's Office at the {{hallName}} with your Tax Declaration or latest Official Receipt. Payment is in cash. Property taxes are due quarterly, but you may pay annually to avail of discounts.

items.question: How do I apply for a Senior Citizen ID?
items.answer: Go to the City Social Welfare and Development Office (MSWDO) with: Birth Certificate or any valid ID showing your age (60 and above), 1x1 ID photo, and Barangay Residence Certificate. The ID is issued for free.

items.question: What benefits do senior citizens receive?
items.answer: Senior citizens enjoy 20% discount and VAT exemption on purchases (with a minimum purchase amount per establishment), priority lanes, and access to special programs and medical assistance from the cityity.

items.question: I found a broken link or error on this website. How do I report it?
items.answer: Thank you for helping us improve! Please send us message at {{volunteerEmail}} and write "Website Issue" as the subject. Describe the problem and include the page URL if possible.

items.question: Is this website mobile-friendly?
items.answer: Yes! Better {{lguName}} is fully responsive and optimized for mobile phones, tablets, and desktop computers.

items.question: Who developed {{siteBrandName}}?
items.answer: This website is an open-source initiative powered by the BetterGov.ph civic-tech framework. It is freely available under the MIT and CC BY 4.0 licenses to encourage digital transformation and community-driven development across local governments.
